The perfect CMS: a clean UI for editors, intuitive yet visually pleasing analytics for decision makers, and a robust API w/ documentation for developers.

I actually think in a lot of ways, the Forms tool in HS is the gold standard. Manage the form as a form, not a portion of a page. View analytics for the form as it's own object or "content type," and all actions related to the form are available via API. Developers have the option to use the built-in markup via embedding, or can also submit to the form using AJAX and handle user flow that way. Either way, the content editors managing the form and the stakeholders looking at the analytics have the tools they need in the UI they want.
